column5: Sorry I haven't been as active as I've wanted to with reports as I've been really busy but took the time to do this one. Headed out to Horwood lake all day Saturday, and did well. 3 largest Walleyes were 31 inches 10.5 lbs, 30 inch 10 lb, and a 28 inch 8 lb. along with those we caught many in the mid-low 20 range and plenty of eaters (16-18 inchers) Here are a few photos from the day. Starting off with my stringer going down to the bigger and bigger ones of the day ending off with the 31 inch beast. My partner had an awesome day too with lots of size as well. Enjoy!
wow, that's some big eyes, looks like you ran all the way down to the Woman River inflow, nice pics
Awesome fish!  How did you catch them?
Awesome pix.  Thanks  Ive fished the watershed area many times, but never so lucky to get monsters like that!   Horwood is on my bucket list.
Very nice! Some trophy fish there.

Two of the big ones were caught jigging sucker minnows and the third was caught on a husky jerk, as for the rest of the day we caught them trolling bottom bouncers with worm harnesses or jigging minnows.
Best Horwood report I've ever seen.  Great fishing dood.  Thanks for posting.
No problem! I know this picture wasn't from those saturday pics but it was from the day before when we got there after work. Here is my partner with a 40 inch 15 lb pike from friday
Nice 'eyes. Im considering a trip to Horwood this year. Hows the new boat?

Fantastic, i've rigged it up a bunch since I bought it. Has a 25 4 stroke on it now, with ipilot installed on the bowmount, threw my elite 5 dsi on the bow attached to the trolling motor and put a humminbird 598 with side imaging back at the tiller. Did the fish finder adjustments the day after these were taken actually
Nice eyes there Tayzack great report and pics thanks for posting got to love that Timmins and Foleyet area great fishing right at your door step.  Cheers Mitch...
